question: An article is listed at 900 Rs. and two successive discounts of 8% and 8% are given on it. How much would the seller gain or lose, if he gives a single discount of 16%, instead of two discounts?
explanation:
Equivalent discount for two successive discounts of 8% and 8%
$latex = \\left ( 8+8-\\frac{8\\times 8}{100} \\right )\\%&s=1$
$latex = \\left ( 16-0.64 \\right )\\% = 15.36\\%$
∴ SP = (100 - 15.36)% of 900
$latex = \\left ( \\frac{84.60\\times 900}{100} \\right ) = 761.76\\ Rs.&s=1$
For a single discount of 16%, SP = 84% of 900
$latex = \\left ( \\frac{84\\times 900}{100} \\right ) = 756\\ Rs.&s=1$
Certainly seller will lose in this case. 
∴ Lose = (761.76 - 756) = 5.76 Rs.
Hence option [D] is correct answer.
